meanings.definition: A scientist who studies the effects of light on living organisms.
meanings.sent1: Photobiologists conduct experiments to understand how light impacts plants and animals.
meanings.sent2: Many photobiologists work in research labs to explore the relationship between light and living organisms.
meanings.sent3: Why did the photobiologists bring a flashlight to the biology conference? To shed light on their research!
meanings.sent4: In the world of biology, photobiologists are the light-bringers, illuminating the secrets of photosynthesis.
meanings.sent5: The photobiologists' findings on how light affects plant growth were as bright as the sun itself.

meanings.definition: Those who specialize in the field of photobiology.
meanings.sent1: The conference was filled with photobiologists eager to share their latest discoveries.
meanings.sent2: Photobiologists often collaborate with botanists and zoologists to deepen their understanding of light's impact.
meanings.sent3: Why did the photobiologists organize a glow-in-the-dark party? To celebrate their bright field of study!
meanings.sent4: In the realm of science, photobiologists are the enlightened ones, guiding us through the mysteries of light and life.
meanings.sent5: The photobiologists' expertise in photobiology shone like a beacon in the scientific community.
